title: Thai green curry chicken

ingredients.original_name: 1 lb chicken thigh, boneless, skinless, 1-inch pieces
ingredients.en_name: 1 lb Chicken Thigh, Boneless, Skinless, 1-inch Pieces

ingredients.original_name: 1 can bamboo shoots strips, drained and rinsed
ingredients.en_name: 1 Can Bamboo Shoots Strips, Drained and Rinsed

ingredients.original_name: 0.25 red bell pepper, or another mild red pepper, julienned
ingredients.en_name: 0.25 Red Bell Pepper, or another mild Red Pepper, julienned

weight_estimate.weight_calculation: Amount of ingredient not specified, LLM estimate is: 1 serving = 0.125 kg, 4 servings * 0.125 kg = 0.5 kg

co2_per_kg_db.closest_match_explanation: The ingredient 'Jasmine Rice for Serving' is a type of rice. The closest match in the database is 'rice, parboiled, raw' as it represents the raw form of rice, which is the most appropriate match given the available options and prioritizing the least processed form according to rule 4.

instructions:
Reduce 0.75 Cup Coconut Milk Until Thick and Coconut Oil Starts To Separate From The Coconut Milk (IF The Oil Does Separate After It Has Reduced Until Very Thick, It's Okay, Just Proceed With The Recipe).
Add the Curry Paste and Saut√©, Stirring Constantly over Medium Heat for About 2 Minutes Until Aromatic. If Paste Sticks to the Bottom of the Pan, You Can Deglaze With A Little Bit Of The Remaining Coconut Milk.
Add Chicken Thigh and Stir to Mix With The Paste. (Continue with Instructions Below IF Using Chicken Breast).
Add the Chicken Stock, Remaining 1 Cup of Coconut Milk, Palm Sugar and 1 Tablespoon of the Fish Sauce. Grab The Makrut Lime Leaves and Twist Them to Bruise and Release Aroma, Then Tear Them Into Chunks and Add Them to the Pot, Discarding the Center Stems. Bring to a simmer and light simmer gently for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is fork tender.
Once the Curry is Done Simmering, Add Bamboo Shoots and Bring to a Boil. If you prefer your peppers to be more cooked, add them at this stage. Once Boiling, Remove From Heat.
Taste and Add More Fish Sauce and or Sugar as Needed.
Add Thai Basil and Spur Chilies or Bell Peppers and Stir Just UNTIL THE BASIL IS WILTED. Serve with jasmine rice
